intro: Dossifluga cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dossifluga, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Dossifluga cuneata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
